title: ELIXIR-EXCELERATE WP2 Benchmarking shared schema definitions

Metadata.title: Platform metadata
Metadata.description: This object contains all the metadata needed in the different OpenEBench processing and platform steps. Its contents should be only generated, validated or managed by OpenEBench programs. The keys of the properties in this object must start either with an underscore or with a namespace. This last case could be considered in the future to identify accesory JSON Schemas which help on further validation

OriginalId.title: The original id of the entry
OriginalId.description: The field is filled in on server side, and it contains the original id in '_id' used on data submission, used by the community

OriginalIdOnSub.description: Identifiers used on submission must not begin with OEB. Client tools must use always this pattern to validate

Revision.title: Entries' revision number
Revision.description: This is a monotonic, incremental counter which changes only when the entry has changed

Created.title: Entries' creation timestamp (internal to the database)

Deleted.title: Entries' deletion timestamp (internal to the database)

Updated.title: Entries' last update's timestamp (internal to the database)

BenchmarkingEventTemporaryId.title: The temporary id of a benchmarking event entry
BenchmarkingEventTemporaryId.description: Temporary identifiers internally used must follow this pattern

BenchmarkingEventId.title: The id of a benchmarking event entry
BenchmarkingEventId.description: Identifiers returned by the APIs must follow this pattern

BenchmarkingEventCanonicalId.title: The canonical id of a benchmarking event entry
BenchmarkingEventCanonicalId.description: Canonical benchmarking event identifiers returned by the APIs must follow this pattern

ChallengeTemporaryId.title: The temporary id of a challenge
ChallengeTemporaryId.description: Temporary identifiers internally used must follow this pattern

ChallengeId.title: The id of a challenge
ChallengeId.description: Identifiers returned by the APIs must follow this pattern

ChallengeCanonicalId.title: The canonical id of a challenge
ChallengeCanonicalId.description: Canonical challenge identifiers returned by the APIs must follow this pattern

CommunityCanonicalId.title: The canonical id of a community
CommunityCanonicalId.description: Canonical community identifiers returned by the APIs must follow this pattern, and they do not include the revision

ContactCanonicalId.title: The canonical id of a contact. It must be a valid ORCID
ContactCanonicalId.description: Canonical contact identifiers returned by the APIs must follow this pattern, and they do not include the revision

DatasetTemporaryId.title: The temporary id of a dataset
DatasetTemporaryId.description: Temporary identifiers internally used must follow this pattern

DatasetId.title: The id of a dataset
DatasetId.description: Identifiers returned by the APIs must follow this pattern

DatasetCanonicalId.title: The canonical id of a dataset
DatasetCanonicalId.description: Canonical dataset identifiers returned by the APIs must follow this pattern

SchemeCanonicalId.title: Namespace acronym, corresponds to the namespace part of Curie (ns:id), so it should not contain invalid patterns

MetricsTemporaryId.title: The temporary id of a metrics definition
MetricsTemporaryId.description: Temporary identifiers internally used must follow this pattern

MetricsId.title: The id of a metrics definition
MetricsId.description: Identifiers returned by the APIs must follow this pattern

MetricsCanonicalId.title: The canonical id of a metrics definition
MetricsCanonicalId.description: Canonical metrics identifiers returned by the APIs must follow this pattern

ReferenceCanonicalId.title: The unique id of the bibliographic reference. It is either its DOI or its PubMedId
ReferenceCanonicalId.description: DOI or PubMed bibliographic identifiers must follow this pattern, and they do not include the revision

TestActionTemporaryId.title: The temporary id of a test action
TestActionTemporaryId.description: Temporary identifiers internally used must follow this pattern

TestActionId.title: The id of a test action
TestActionId.description: Identifiers returned by the APIs must follow this pattern

TestActionCanonicalId.title: The canonical id of a test action
TestActionCanonicalId.description: Canonical test action identifiers returned by the APIs must follow this pattern

ToolTemporaryId.title: The temporary id of a tool
ToolTemporaryId.description: Temporary identifiers internally used must follow this pattern

ToolId.title: The id of a tool
ToolId.description: Identifiers returned by the APIs must follow this pattern

ToolCanonicalId.title: The canonical id of a tool
ToolCanonicalId.description: Canonical tool identifiers returned by the APIs must follow this pattern

@canonical_id.title: The canonical id of the entry
@canonical_id.description: The field is filled in on server side, and it contains the canonical id, which is in some cases the content of '_id', plus its revision

orig_id.title: The original id of the entry

description.title: Long community, benchmarking event or challenge description, written in Markdown

links.title: Ways to contact the community. It can be many different ones: public page, a social media link, some public chat, a public mailing list, ...

uri.title: The helpdesk mail, main website, social media URL (LinkedIn, Twitter, etc...), public chat URL, etc...

comment.title: Internal comment about this URI (useful when the type of URI is other)
